item.title: XWiki 15.0 Release Candidate 1 Released
item.description: The XWiki development team is proud to announce the availability of the first release candidate of XWiki 15.0. This release consists mostly of dependency upgrades and bug fixes including security fixes with some small new features for admins and developers. ...
item.dc:subject: Blog.Releases
item.dc:creator: Michael Hamann

item.title: XWiki 14.10.3 Released
item.description: The XWiki development team is proud to announce the availability of XWiki 14.10.3. This is a bugfix release (includes security fixes) that covers important issues that we have discovered since 14.10.2 has been released. ...
item.dc:subject: Blog.Releases
item.dc:creator: Manuel Leduc

item.title: XWiki 13.10.11 Released
item.description: The XWiki development team is proud to announce the availability of XWiki 13.10.11. This is a bugfix release and the last release of the 13.10.x branch (since the 14.10.x branch is now the new LTS branch). It is a recommended upgrade for anyone using XWiki 13.10.x and who cannot upgrade to 14.10.x yet, as it contains several security fixes. ...
item.dc:subject: Blog.Releases
item.dc:creator: Vincent Massol

item.title: XWiki 14.10.2 Released
item.description: This release is the first release of the new 14.10.x LTS branch (replacing the 13.10.x LTS). It is mainly a bugfix release that covers important issues that we have discovered since 14.10.1 has been released, but it also contains some improvments in code macro and include macro. It also contains fixes for several security vulnerabilities, making it a recommended upgrade. ...
item.dc:subject: Blog.Releases
item.dc:creator: Simon Urli

item.title: Highlights of XWiki 14.x cycle
item.description:
December is almost over and this means we're finishing the XWiki 14.x cycle. It's time to look back at what we achieved in 2022. Here are some links to visual reports of what was done in 14.x:

  • High importance changes
  • Medium importance changes
  • Low importance changes
  • All changes having screenshots
  • All user-related changes ...
item.dc:subject: Blog.News
item.dc:creator: Vincent Massol

item.title: XWiki 14.10.1 Released
item.description: This is mainly a bugfix release that covers important issues that we have discovered since 14.10 has been released. However, it also comes with an improved attachment gallery picker and a way for developers to restrict when it's allowed to execute a template. It also included fixes for several security vulnerabilities, making it a recommended upgrade. ...
item.dc:subject: Blog.Releases
item.dc:creator: Thomas Mortagne

item.title: XWiki 14.10 Released
item.description: This release includes a new export dialog, makes the new browser-based PDF export and the new image selector the default, adds a feature to restrict attachment mimetypes and makes the UI more consistent by adding breadcrumbs in more cases. It also fixes bugs including several security vulnerabilities, making it a recommended upgrade. ...

item.title: XWiki 13.10.10 Released
item.description: The XWiki development team is proud to announce the availability of XWiki 13.10.10. This is a bugfix release (includes security fixes) that covers important issues that we have discovered since 13.10.9 has been released. ...

item.dc:creator: Marius Dumitru Florea

item.title: XWiki 14.9 Released
item.description: This releases improves the new client-side PDF Export feature (still experimental but getting closer to being production ready) by offering the ability to configure it in the Admin UI and by enhancing the default template. It also fixes bugs and especially several security bugs, making it a recommended upgrade. ...
item.dc:subject: Blog.Releases
item.dc:creator: Manuel Leduc

item.title: XWiki 14.9 Release Candidate 1 Released
item.description: This releases improves the new client-side PDF Export feature (still experimental but getting closer to being production ready) by offering the ability to configure it in the Admin UI and by enhancing the default template. It also fixes bugs and especially several security bugs, making it a recommended upgrade. ...
